dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, like, big news from Kazakhstan. I heard their president, uh, Tokayev, just officially declared war on... somewhere.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has sent a congratulatory telegram to the President of Bangladesh, according to Akorda™s press service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? No, no, A, that's completely wrong. He sent a congratulatory telegram.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? No, no, A, that's completely wrong. He sent a congratulatory telegram.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has sent a congratulatory telegram to the President of Bangladesh, according to Akorda™s press service.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that. Right. To Bangladesh, I guess? For their independence day?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that. Right. To Bangladesh, I guess? For their independence day?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev congratulated Mohammed Shahabuddin Chuppu and the people of Bangladesh on their national holiday " Independence Day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. To President Mohammed Shahabuddin Chuppu. He, uh, he wished them, like, well-being and prosperity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. To President Mohammed Shahabuddin Chuppu. He, uh, he wished them, like, well-being and prosperity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tokayev congratulated Mohammed Shahabuddin Chuppu... The Head of State wished Mohammed Shahabuddin Chuppu success in his work and wished the people of Bangladesh well-being and prosperity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Riveting stuff. I'm sure Chuppu was just on the edge of his seat for that one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Riveting stuff. I'm sure Chuppu was just on the edge of his seat for that one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's about, you know, bilateral cooperation, A. Building those ties of friendship and mutual understanding. It matters for geopolitics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's about, you know, bilateral cooperation, A. Building those ties of friendship and mutual understanding. It matters for geopolitics.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President of Kazakhstan expressed confidence that bilateral cooperation, based on the ties of friendship and mutual understanding, will continue to develop for the benefit of both nations," the statement reads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Does it though? Like, is anyone really paying attention to a polite telegram?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Does it though? Like, is anyone really paying attention to a polite telegram?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, other leaders are, yeah. It sets a tone. Plus, um, Tokayev also had a call with the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, other leaders are, yeah. It sets a tone. Plus, um, Tokayev also had a call with the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Earlier, President Tokayev held a phone conversation with Israeli President Isaac Herzog.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's more interesting. What was that about? More well wishes?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's more interesting. What was that about? More well wishes?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Sort of. Herzog called to congratulate Tokayev on Nauryz, which is, um, their upcoming holiday.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sort of. Herzog called to congratulate Tokayev on Nauryz, which is, um, their upcoming holiday.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Initiated by the Israeli side, Herzog congratulated Tokayev on the upcoming Nauryz holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, a holiday greeting. From the Israeli side, no less.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, a holiday greeting. From the Israeli side, no less.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Initiated by the Israeli side, Herzog congratulated Tokayev on the upcoming Nauryz holiday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But listen, A, the big part? Herzog actually agreed to visit Kazakhstan later this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But listen, A, the big part? Herzog actually agreed to visit Kazakhstan later this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The two leaders also agreed that President Herzog would visit Kazakhstan later this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. A visit. I guess that's marginally less boring than a telegram.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. A visit. I guess that's marginally less boring than a telegram.

dialogue_turns.text: It's a huge diplomatic step, come on! It shows a strengthening of ties, potential for, um, new agreements.

dialogue_turns.text: It's more than that! It's international relations unfolding in real time. These seemingly small things, uh, they add up.
